resources.string: Check here Jardín Tourist sites for you to plan well your stay in this beautiful town of Antioquia. There are plenty things to do: nature walks, estaderos and trucheras, bird watching, swimming pools, rivers, paragliding, museums and monuments known, aerial cable and pulley. We hope you enjoy your trip!!

Phone Number: 845 6850 
 Address: Km 1, vía Jardín Ríosucio 800 mts from the town
 Services:
 Accommodation
 Pool, Steam Bath, Sauna and Jacuzzi
 Restaurant, Rancho, Bar, Fonda and Milling Season
 Farm and Lake
 Volleyball court and soccer field
 Billiards, table tennis and board games

Phone Numbers: 3113094338 - 8456844
 Address: Parque principal Jardín
 Website: www.balconesdelparque.com
 Total capacity: 44 people, located in double and triple rooms with private bathroom, hot water, cable TV and mini bar.
 Services: Restaurant, Wet Area (Steambath and Jacuzzi), games and reading room, Wireless Internet, Room Service.

Phone Number: 3103806724 
Address: Carrera 3 # 9-14 - Parque Principal

Capacity: 60 People 
Fully equipped apartments in the Hotel. 
For security the hotel is protected with video cameras.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/laargelia 
Address: Km 1 vereda la salada Jardín 
Services: 
Restaurant - Bar - Truchería 
Nature Walks 
Milling

The route to arrive at La Cueva del Esplendor is a terrific show, and the cave itself honors its name. To get there you can go on horseback or on foot along a bridle path accompanied by an expert guide. 
Location: Vereda La Linda - Northeast of Jardín 10 kms 
Information and Reservations 
2516344 - 3003524763

Is a neo-Gothic temple with an area of 1.680m² 
The basilica has 128 windows and skylights and two Hamburger bells. The statue of San Juan Bautista, the holy water font, the tabernacle, and the pulpit are made out of Carrara marble. Its interior is painted turquoise. Its two towers and crosses are made of aluminum.

Is located in the upper part of the gorge La Salada in the village of the same name five kilometers from the county seat. 
This is a waterfall that falls between the mountains rising around a cave inhabited by Guácharos 
Time to visit approx. 3 to 4 hours

Población Total: 14.177 hab 
Zona urbana: 92,0/%% 
Zona rural: 83,7/%% 
Etnografía 
Según las cifras presentadas por el DANE del censo 2005, la composición etnográfica del municipio es: 
Mestizos y Blancos (89,3/%%) 
Indígenas (10,0/%%) 
Afrocolombianos (0,7/%%)
